C1 in a way that involves someone doing something they do not want to do: "Yes, all right. I'll go," she agreed, somewhat unwillingly. They are being unwillingly dragged into the debate. See
unwilling
More examplesFewer examples He retired last year, unwillingly.They were ordinary people, unwillingly caught up in the war."My parents won't let me go home alone," she admitted unwillingly.
